articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Daphne Psaledakis, David Lawder
articles.description: Trump said he would talk with the leaders of Canada and Mexico, which have announced retaliatory tariffs of their own, but downplayed expectations that they would change his mind.
articles.title: Trump says Americans may feel 'pain' in trade war with Mexico, Canada, China

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the policies of U.S. President Donald Trump were pushing Europe to take more responsibility for its own physical and economic security.
articles.title: Russia and Trump push Europe to be more independent, Macron says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea aims to rebuild its aviation safety system from scratch, the transport ministry said on Tuesday, launching a new committee to improve air travel in the country that suffered two major aviation incidents a month apart.
articles.title: South Korea wants to rebuild aviation safety system after crash, fire incidents

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Marco Rubio, who is on his first oversees tour as the top US diplomat, is seeking support from countries in the region for the Trump administration's attempts to deport large numbers of migrants.
articles.title: El Salvador offers to house criminals deported from the U.S. in its jails

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Malaysia will actively build trade relations with other countries, such as China, Russia and Brazil, instead of waiting for the impact of potential U.S. trade tariffs, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Malaysia PM says will build trade relations, not wait for U.S. tariffs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has invited Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit the White House next week, a White House official said, hours after a U.S. military plane departed to return deported migrants to the country.
articles.title: India's Modi invited to meet with Trump next week, White House official says

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Five Arab foreign ministers and a senior Palestinian official sent a joint letter to U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio opposing plans to displace Palestinians from Gaza, as suggested by President Donald Trump in late January.
articles.title: Arab nations oppose removing Palestinians from Gaza in letter to US

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: A federal prosecutor appointed by President Donald Trump asked Elon Musk for information about anyone trying to impede the work of the billionaire's government efficiency effort, warning of possible criminal sanctions, in a letter posted on platform X on Monday.
articles.title: US prosecutor warns of legal risk for anyone hindering Musk's efficiency effort

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: There are at least six Americans wrongfully held in prison in Venezuela, U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy Richard Grenell said on Monday, three days after returning to the U.S. from Venezuela having secured the release of six other Americans.
articles.title: US envoy says at least six Americans still wrongfully held in Venezuelan prisons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The emotional reunion of twin brothers in Gaza after Israel allowed movement within the enclave as part of a ceasefire deal provided a visceral image of Palestinian survival after 15 gruelling months of death, separation and destruction.
articles.title: Gaza's reunited twins speak of loss and joy
